questions.question: 熱があるので、（＿）を測りました。
questions.hint:
熱ねつ (netsu) - fever
測るはかる (hakaru) - to measure

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『体温』(たいおん, taion) means 'body temperature,' which is measured when you have a fever.

  • 1. 体温 – body temperature (たいおん, taion)
  • 2. 身長 – height (しんちょう, shinchou)
  • 3. 体重 – weight (たいじゅう, taijuu)
  • 4. 血圧 – blood pressure (けつあつ, ketsuatsu)

English Translation: I had a fever, so I measured my temperature.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 体温 (たいおん, taion) – body temperature
The only measurement relevant to fever.

questions.question: このシャツ、試着したいのですが、（＿）はどこですか？
questions.hint:
試着しちゃく (shichaku) - trying on clothes
シャツ (shatsu) - shirt

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『試着室』(しちゃくしつ, shichakushitsu) means 'fitting room.'

  • 1. レジ – register (れじ, reji)
  • 2. 試着室 – fitting room (しちゃくしつ, shichakushitsu)
  • 3. エレベーター – elevator (えれべーたー, erebeetaa)
  • 4. 駐車場 – parking lot (ちゅうしゃじょう, chuushajou)

English Translation: I’d like to try on this shirt—where’s the fitting room?
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 試着室 (しちゃくしつ, shichakushitsu) – fitting room
It’s the only place meant for trying on clothes.

questions.question: 次の駅で（＿）ので、荷物をまとめ始めました。
questions.hint:
荷物にもつ (nimotsu) - luggage
まとめる (matomeru) - to gather/pack

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『乗り換える』(のりかえる, norikaeru) means 'to transfer trains,' which explains why the speaker is preparing their bags.

  • 1. 乗り換える – transfer (のりかえる, norikaeru)
  • 2. 寝る – sleep (ねる, neru)
  • 3. 食べる – eat (たべる, taberu)
  • 4. 働く – work (はたらく, hataraku)

English Translation: I’m transferring at the next station, so I started organizing my luggage.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 乗り換える (のりかえる, norikaeru) – transfer
Only this option explains preparing luggage at a train station.

questions.question: ゴミを（＿）に分けて出すようにしています。
questions.hint:
分けるわける (wakeru) - to separate/sort
ゴミ (gomi) - trash

explanation.correct:
Correct!
『種類』(しゅるい, shurui) means 'type' or 'category.' This is how trash is commonly sorted in Japan.

  • 1. 種類 – type/category (しゅるい, shurui)
  • 2. 色 – color (いろ, iro)
  • 3. 形 – shape (かたち, katachi)
  • 4. 重さ – weight (おもさ, omosa)

English Translation: I always try to sort the trash by type when disposing it.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 種類 (しゅるい, shurui) – type/category
In Japan, garbage is typically sorted by category, not color or weight.
